review_preview: We visited here for the tasting menu and everything was spot on from start to finish; the staff were really friendly and the restaurant was quiet.Each course had something different to offer, from perfectly grilled octopus to tart ceviche - the steak cooked at...
review_full: We visited here for the tasting menu and everything was spot on from start to finish; the staff were really friendly and the restaurant was quiet. Each course had something different to offer, from perfectly grilled octopus to tart ceviche - the steak cooked at the table on a Himalayan salt stone was also an excellent touch. The courses are paired wines, starting with cava, followed by white, red and a dessert wine. The bill, including two espressos, came to just over €100 which is good value in my opinion. I've had tasting menus in the UK for double the price, and the flavours and service were just as good. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Madrid!

title_review: Great brunch with entertainers for kids included
review_preview: We went there on a Sunday for a family brunch. We were celebrating a birthday. We were two couples and two children age 5 and 12. The food (buffet style) was delicious. The theme of the brunch was Mexico, and in addition to what you...
review_full: We went there on a Sunday for a family brunch. We were celebrating a birthday. We were two couples and two children age 5 and 12. The food (buffet style) was delicious. The theme of the brunch was Mexico, and in addition to what you would expect of a brunch buffet, they also served tacos, enchiladas and ceviche. The specialty drink had tequila and rose liqueur (delicious). The food was very good, with a lot of selection for a brunch menu. About an hour into the meal, as the kids were starting to get bored, an entertainer came to get the kids. They went to another room and made ballon animals. That was great because it gave us a chance to eat at our leisure without having to worry about the kids. At the end, the waiters brought a birthday cake, which I thought was a very nice gesture. The price was 54 euros per person and half of that for the children, a reasonable price for the amount, quality and variety of food served. We will most definitely return to have brunch at the Jardin at the Intercontinental.

review_preview: We had a superp dinner here the last night we were at this hotel. They start serving dinner at 8:00 pm. We ordered  tomatoe soup and shrimp for a starter. They had a little bowl of shrimp mousse covered with crushed nuts as a welcome...
review_full: We had a superp dinner here the last night we were at this hotel. They start serving dinner at 8:00 pm. We ordered tomatoe soup and shrimp for a starter. They had a little bowl of shrimp mousse covered with crushed nuts as a welcome gesture for us. My husband ordered vegetarian paella. He claimed that he had never had a better taste than that one. It was served to him in portions which meant that it was still warm to the last bite. For me, I wanted to have grilled salmon but it was not on their menu. However, nothing is impossible in that place; the Chef would prepare the food that you wish to eat because it is not pre prepared, it is done right then and there. This shows quite clearly in the taste and texture. We ended our meal by ordering gelato and cream brule' and again, we were impressed. We really enjoyed our meal there. The service was excellent. I strongly recommend this place. It is on the expensive side but it is worth every bit of it.

title_review: Tremendous, the finest restaurant I've been to.
review_preview: We dined in the garden (fantastic setting) on three nights (twice for dinner, once just for dessert) and every item of each course was tremendous. A tip of the hat to the chef and his team for the amazing meals they prepared for us each...
review_full: We dined in the garden (fantastic setting) on three nights (twice for dinner, once just for dessert) and every item of each course was tremendous. A tip of the hat to the chef and his team for the amazing meals they prepared for us each night, the beef tenderloin was my own personal favourite (although the Intercontinental cakes come a close second). The little extras (including the appetisers, breads/oil and chocolate truffles) really made the nights special. As good as the meals and setting were, it was the service which really made the nights and we can't express our gratitude enough to Abilio and the rest of the staff for looking after us so well. 5 stars.

title_review: A lovely outdoor seating area, with good food and service
review_preview: The stand-out aspect of this restaurant for me was the outdoor seating area. There are very few places I would rather have been for an evening meal - under the open sky, with beautiful lighting as it got dark, and a quiet, peaceful atmosphere.The...
review_full: The stand-out aspect of this restaurant for me was the outdoor seating area. There are very few places I would rather have been for an evening meal - under the open sky, with beautiful lighting as it got dark, and a quiet, peaceful atmosphere. The food itself was lovely; a bread service was provided with olive oil, and two taster dishes with compliments of the chef. For my main course, I had the duck stew: delicious, tender duck with rice, fruit and a sauce that tasted much like soy sauce. My friend's paella was prepared table-side. The waiters were helpful and attentive, and very helpful when it came to deciding what to have! The only downside to this restaurant was that I felt it was all a little over priced - however, for one visit, this didn't ruin the experience.

review_preview: We went to the Sunday brunch at the Intercontinental and were not disappointed. The food is excellent and there is plenty of variation. Sushi, lobster, paella, meat, salads. Enjoyed the sashimi the most. Desserts were great, couldn't resist trying about all of them. Since we...
review_full: We went to the Sunday brunch at the Intercontinental and were not disappointed. The food is excellent and there is plenty of variation. Sushi, lobster, paella, meat, salads. Enjoyed the sashimi the most. Desserts were great, couldn't resist trying about all of them. Since we had something to celebrate, we ended with a personalized cake I had requested by email a few days prior to the brunch. Very well done, made it all the more special. It's not the cheapest place in Madrid to go to, but the quality of the food, the atmosphere and the outstanding staff made it worth it, without a doubt.

review_preview: Tried this restaurant after staying in the Intercontinental Hotel for a week should have tried it sooner. The food, service, atmosphere, ambience is exemplary. The restaurant is in the garden patio area and kept cool with mist spraying fans (very quite). The waiting staff is...
review_full: Tried this restaurant after staying in the Intercontinental Hotel for a week should have tried it sooner. The food, service, atmosphere, ambience is exemplary. The restaurant is in the garden patio area and kept cool with mist spraying fans (very quite). The waiting staff is very attentive always willing to help in choosing the correct dishes. The head waiter recommended a very good Spanish red, the monk fish was excellent and as it happened turned out to be the house speciality, the cheesecake for dessert was the lightest I have had in a long time. Before the first course we were given a small seafood salad complementary as was the chocolates after the dessert. The biggest surprise of the night was the price which was very competitive less than 110 euro for two people three course and a very nice bottle of red would highly recommend you give this restaurant a go.

title_review: Great location and excellent club lounge
review_preview: My husband and I stayed here for three nights last March making use of the club lounge facilities.  The standard room we were in overlooked the inner courtyard and had its own little balcony, which would have been great if the weather was  warmer. Having...
review_full: My husband and I stayed here for three nights last March making use of the club lounge facilities. The standard room we were in overlooked the inner courtyard and had its own little balcony, which would have been great if the weather was warmer. Having said that the balmy 16 degrees was great for exploring the city. We were able to walk for miles without feeling enervated by the heat. The room was quite small and had a rather strange shape but it was adequate for our needs.  As the food on offer in the club lounge was so good, both for breakfast and in the evening for 'snacks', we ended up not needing to sample the restaurant! The wines on offer were delicious and many of the hot snacks were so filling we couldn't have eaten or drunk any more! The hotel was very well situated for exploring all the main tourist sites in central Madrid and yet as it is in a quieter location at night we got a good night's sleep. A good place for a short break and it was definitely worth paying for the club lounge facilities.

title_review: Authentic Georgian food in the heart of Madrid - an enjoyable experience
review_preview: I love everything about Georgia - a little Caucasian country with rich history and even richer culture, and most of all I love Georgian cuisine. So, accidentally bumping into Georgian restaurant in the very centre of Madrid, I couldn’t miss having a meal there. And...
review_full: I love everything about Georgia - a little Caucasian country with rich history and even richer culture, and most of all I love Georgian cuisine. So, accidentally bumping into Georgian restaurant in the very centre of Madrid, I couldn’t miss having a meal there. And it was a feast, accompanied by a bottle of my favorite Georgian red wine Saperavi! A wide choice of khachapuri - pies with cheese and a variety of fillings, depending on which country region recipe it is done; savory khinkali (dumplings filled with minced meat), tender chashushuli (meat stew with veggies)... Fantastic meal, warm atmosphere and very attentive service made our day!

review_preview: Having never had Georgian food before, I didn't know what to expect. I don't know if it's the fault of the restaurant or the cuisine, but this was a pretty sad dinner experience overall.The restaurant looks very nice from the outside, but don't let...
review_full: Having never had Georgian food before, I didn't know what to expect. I don't know if it's the fault of the restaurant or the cuisine, but this was a pretty sad dinner experience overall. The restaurant looks very nice from the outside, but don't let this lure you in. The food is extremely plain and disappointing. My girlfriend had the khachapuri which is basically just egg and cheese on a sort of pizza dough. Good enough for what it was, but overall just kind of sad. I can't attest to the authenticity of the dish, but as it was it feels completely unworthy of being a main dish. I had the chef's recommendation of steamed buns filled with minced meat (basically like dim sum/gyoza). The meat was well seasoned but the dish was just underwhelming; it felt like it was missing a lot of other things to provide anything close to a fulfilling meal. None of the other things described to us from the menu sounded remotely appealing, and even the chef was shaking his head when talking about some of them. Despite Georgia having a rich winemaking tradition, all they had to drink was Spanish wine, unfortunately. The wine was good, sure, but you can find that anywhere and you can actually pair it with much better/more interesting food. Also note that the value for money here is not great. Overall, I feel it is a shame to waste a meal on this place when you're in Madrid and have such amazing choices available almost everywhere. I cannot understand how this place has such a high rating.

title_review: A wonderful dinner with a great atmosphere!
review_preview: We had a lovely dinner with my boyfriend in this top-rated restaurant, located in a walking distance from Puerta del Sol. A table reservation is recommendable, and we needed to wait for a bit before getting a table. As a main course we had a...
review_full: We had a lovely dinner with my boyfriend in this top-rated restaurant, located in a walking distance from Puerta del Sol. A table reservation is recommendable, and we needed to wait for a bit before getting a table. As a main course we had a big portion of tenderloin meant for sharing and we took the advice to try an excellent Argentine wine with it. The staff was extremely nice and helpful, and they also advised us to try their white chocolate mousse as a dessert. The dessert was absolutely incredible with a delicious passion fruit sauce! Casa Jaguar remains to be our favorite restaurant in Madrid.

review_preview: Unsuspecting place, not very big with only a limited seating capacity. But the steaks are fabulous, one of the best i ever had. So were the fries. And nice baguette with addictive chimichurri. I ate whole basket on my own and couldnt stop. Wifey had...

And nice baguette with addictive chimichurri. I ate whole basket on my own and couldnt stop. Wifey had a peperoni pizza and said it was good enough. This place really caught us by surprise. Staff was very kind and smiling. Only slight negative was their half-opened kitchen. Searing a steak produces quite some smoke. Their ventilation was pretty effective but there was a smell of burnt beef fat lingering in the air anyway. But it was not that intrusive, just being picky. This place deserves 5 stars for very nice and honest food for reasonable price. And nice staff.

review_preview: There are two dishes in this restaurant you shouldn't be missed:The first one is cheese wheel pasta without truffles.Basically, the pasta is cooked by the chefs and then finished off at the table by the waiting staff as you look on drooling into...
review_full: There are two dishes in this restaurant you shouldn't be missed: The first one is cheese wheel pasta without truffles. Basically, the pasta is cooked by the chefs and then finished off at the table by the waiting staff as you look on drooling into your napkin. They swirl the pasta around a wheel of Parmesa coat it in the cheese. The idea is that the heat will slowly melt the cheese on the edge of the wheel, thus coating the pasta to perfection. By adding extra cheese and nuts on top, They created seriously tasty cheese wheel pasta. You shouldn't miss this dish if you are in Madrid, yes, you may find a better one in Italy but may not in Madrid. The second must try dish is the most famous Italian dessert in the world - Tiramisu and it is one of our absolute favorite desserts. You can find the truly best homemade of the best Tiramisu in this tiny little restaurant. This is the dish you shouldn't be miss if you come to Madrid!  I tried also cheese wheel with truffles and mix seafood pasta, I think these two are average. But I still like the ve this restaurant as staffs are extremely popular friendly, foods are good and at a reasonable price, and very comfortable casual atmosphere !

title_review: Nice to eat outside but not on the street
review_preview: This restaurant is in the interior of a big hotel. Most outdoor restaurants are on sidewalks with street, so it's nice to have outdoor dining without street noise and fumes. The ambiance is rather bland, however. The bread selections were nice and warm and crisp...
review_full: This restaurant is in the interior of a big hotel. Most outdoor restaurants are on sidewalks with street, so it's nice to have outdoor dining without street noise and fumes. The ambiance is rather bland, however. The bread selections were nice and warm and crisp and the olive oil really delicious. The artichokes and ham was very tasty. The monkfish was not great. The service was not as attentive as other great restaurants in Madrid ( Triciclo, Candela). The worst part was that the seating was on a wooden platform and every time the waiters walked by everything on the table shook in a jarring way. I thought the flower vase would bounce off the table it would jump so much when the waiters walked by. One waiter seemed to walk smoothly; the rest were oblivious. Even though the were constantly stomping back and forth, our water glasses would go empty ( even though we were eating at an odd time so there were only 2 other tables with guests). 3 stars may seem harsh, but I'm taking into account the fact that the price was the same as our meal at Triciclo, which was heaps better.

review_preview: An excellent buffet. We went here for Sunday lunch for my partners birthday. We had reserved via telephone. At first they could not find my name but eventually did. Tables for two are in disappointing locations tables for four or large groups are better placed....
review_full: An excellent buffet. We went here for Sunday lunch for my partners birthday. We had reserved via telephone. At first they could not find my name but eventually did. Tables for two are in disappointing locations tables for four or large groups are better placed. We got our table but I switched the seating arrangement as I was facing towards the entrance, no one seemed bothered or came to help. Service is a bit slow to start and if you have not been before it is difficult to know how it works as no one explains. We had to ask for wine list most people seem to drink by the glass. A varied choice with some excellent starters. You could fill up on first courses alone. Mains were good, pork or beef but lots of other dishes. Desserts were lovely and there was also a chocolate fountain. We had lots to eat, all very tasty.. Although this is a self service a bit more attentiveness re pouring our wine would have been good. Cannot fault the food. There were two opera singers entertaining. The female had the better voice but at times reached the top of her range. I would recommend experiencing the buffet but would suggest pushing for a better table. It was quite obvious that some locals who seemed to be known to the staff got better service and for this reason I am not giving this five stars. We have had more attentive service elsewhere.

review_preview: I went to Casa Jaguar for a weekday lunch and had the menu del dia for 12 EUR. I'll get the criticism out the way first; which is the lack of selection on the menu del dia with 1 starter to choose from, 2 main...
review_full: I went to Casa Jaguar for a weekday lunch and had the menu del dia for 12 EUR. I'll get the criticism out the way first; which is the lack of selection on the menu del dia with 1 starter to choose from, 2 main courses and 1 pudding. None the less the food was enjoyable: I started with the potato soup, while they also provided some crispy bread with cream cheese on the side. My main course was meatballs filled with spinach and quinoa, covered with a tomato sauce. This was served with potato wedges and a small salad. The pudding was some kind of cake with mango which I couldn't fit so had a coffee. Overall the quality of the food was good and the staff were nice.

review_preview: We have been dining at Etimo since 2018 and have greatly enjoyed Chef Begonia Fraire's  outstanding culinary delights.  We recently went in October 2020 to celebrate my birthday.  It was an awesome experience. We thought 10 courses would be too much, but it was perfect!...
review_full: We have been dining at Etimo since 2018 and have greatly enjoyed Chef Begonia Fraire's outstanding culinary delights. We recently went in October 2020 to celebrate my birthday. It was an awesome experience. We thought 10 courses would be too much, but it was perfect! This is Haut Cuisine at its finest with Spanish ingredients, flavours, and themes. The result is a superb feast for the eyes and the palate! Especially creative are the flavors from Estremadura Province she blends into her art. On previous occasions we've had the wine pairing, which included an array of sherries that went exceedingly well with the meal. Etimo is an overall exceptional experience, including the service. Don't miss it when you're in Madrid!

title_review: This is the food I came to Madrid for!
review_preview: I got here early on a Thursday night because, from the reviews I had read, I knew that it got very busy. Instead, I was only their second customer. This was early in the COVID-19 period, but it had had an effect on foot traffic...
review_full: I got here early on a Thursday night because, from the reviews I had read, I knew that it got very busy. Instead, I was only their second customer. This was early in the COVID-19 period, but it had had an effect on foot traffic in restaurants around Madrid.  No matter... the restaurant is neat and stylishly laid out. I could see why it would be a happening place under normal circumstances. The service was great. I chatted with one of the waiters, who helped me out with wine and dish selections. They were pretty much spot on. I had the sea bass, which was outstanding, and a portobello carpaccio. Normally these dishes would be shared, but I was there myself, so the carpaccio was a bit too much mushroom overall for me. It was still good, though. Just better with a smaller individual portion. I can't remember what I had for dessert (I think pineapple was involved?), but it was fantastic. And the waiter commended me on my choice, so that's always nice.  Anyway, I highly recommend. Great food, lovely setting, and - presumably - a fantastic atmosphere. They treated me very well.

title_review: Great food & wine with excellent service
review_preview: Decided to try El Sur de Huertas as we were in the neighbourhood & based off the great reviews on Google. We were not disappointed. This is a great little local restaurant with great food & wine & the service provided by Peter was excellent....

If one goes to Luke, Gros, A’Barra, flavours of each dish explode in mouth, not so @ Etimo’ 3rd — for 1 star establishment wine list of red & white wines seemed reasonably limited.  Conclusion — Etimo seems to copy Arzark in San Sebastián visual presentation. Begonia should work towards cresting better flavour in her dishes.

title_review: Hospitality and food that would be difficult to match!
review_preview: Found this on trip advisor and impressed by amazing reviews. At first concerned by the small size of the restaurant but please go inside, it’s incredible! It has very bright lighting but the food is certainly worth foregoing a romantic atmosphere. As others have mentioned...
review_full: Found this on trip advisor and impressed by amazing reviews. At first concerned by the small size of the restaurant but please go inside, it’s incredible! It has very bright lighting but the food is certainly worth foregoing a romantic atmosphere. As others have mentioned the Menu del Dia is exceptional value. It’s is served all day and evening and is made up of many courses, in all our years of visiting Madrid we’ve never seen a menu like this. The staff are attentive and keen to please and even offered to change any course if we didn’t like it. They serve complimentary popcorn at the beginning and cocktails at the end of the meal. The cocktail is homemade and delicious an orange mojito with coconut and rum. We will definitely go back.

This Argentinian/Spanish restaurante with a modern twist wins the trifecta of great food & wine, service and ambience.  Cerviche, beef, cauliflower all fantastic as other reviewers have said. Both the pineapple and crepe deserts were right-sized and delicious. The complementary limoncello excellent. The Noodles with tuna sashimi also great tho a touch salty for our tastes.  The wait staff were all attentive, interesting and helpful. Our waiter was also an artist of some talent (see photos). The bill was a pleasant surprise at 100€ for 4 including wine.

Rice was good. Total with two glasses of wine and two softies: €73.40

title_review: Really really good. Outstanding food, service and atmosphere
review_preview: My wife is from Madrid. We live in Germany and when we visit, she always takes me out to a special place. This time it was Etimo. All in all: wonderful evening, awesome food, excellent service in a super cool atmosphere with some specials I...
review_full: My wife is from Madrid. We live in Germany and when we visit, she always takes me out to a special place. This time it was Etimo.  All in all: wonderful evening, awesome food, excellent service in a super cool atmosphere with some specials I never saw before.  We had the six course surprise menu. Already the greeting from the kitchen the soup of mushrooms and whiskey with a cheese was mind blowing. I loved the anchoa as well. And from the menu my favorites were the lubina, the corzo, the carabinero and the rhubarb sorbet.  Great wine recommendation as well.  And top service. Super attentive and speaking Spanish I could understand. I love that you don’t charge for the water and you even offer ice and lemon.  Was pretty surprised you don’t have a star yet. It’s gonna come soon I bet.  Very nice interior by the way.  Thank you. All the best! Florian and Elena

title_review: Awesome service and yummy Indian food
review_preview: We are Indians living in US and we’re visiting Spain for vacation. After over a week of enjoying Spanish and Catalunya food we wanted to try out “home food”, the spicy Indian curry. We visited Curry Y Canela based on high reviews in Trip Advisor,...
review_full: We are Indians living in US and we’re visiting Spain for vacation. After over a week of enjoying Spanish and Catalunya food we wanted to try out “home food”, the spicy Indian curry. We visited Curry Y Canela based on high reviews in Trip Advisor, and we found this even better than the reviews we had read. We ordered potato Bhajji for appraiser, a glass of red wine, chicken curry, garlic nan bread and Mountain fried rice. The red wine suggested was really good. All the dishes were very tasty. Trust me our family enjoys high quality Indian curries regularly at home, so when I say it was so yummy, it really was. The mountain fried rice is a very simple vegetable fried rice, but it’s something exemplary. The texture and right combinations of spices, not very overwhelming, was done really well. It matched high recommendations by others. While the food is yummy, the service and atmosphere was even better. They made good suggestions on proportions, we are not big eaters, so they were very happy to allow us to share food, were happy to take our pictures to give us a memorable evening. Thank you so much!

review_full: I saw a sign board on the Gran Via for a set price lunch (10 Euro) that looked interesting - or at least acceptable - and I was delighted to find that it was more than advertised in every way. The service was attentive and friendly; little extras (like a slice of Spanish tortilla) appeared in addition to the set menu items, and the flank steak I chose was one of the best tasting pieces of grilled beef I've had in a while. Portions are generous, even the flan, and as we all know, you can never have too much flan! They're open from early in the morning, too, so I'll come back and see what they come up with for breakfast.

title_review: Very delicious meat and fast service
review_preview: It is a tiny Argentinian place in the city centre of Madrid. We went there for dinner and happened to catch the rush hour. However, we were asked to wait until a table frees. Considering the size of the place, the only option to wait...
review_full: It is a tiny Argentinian place in the city centre of Madrid. We went there for dinner and happened to catch the rush hour. However, we were asked to wait until a table frees. Considering the size of the place, the only option to wait was outdoors. Thus, if you plan to go there and do not want to wait, book a table in advance. Despite the rush hour, the service was very fast. We were waiting 5-10 minutes and got our table. And the waiting was worth because it was the best meat we enjoyed during the week in Madrid. Tender, tasty and juicy. It was properly for our taste. Highly recommended!

title_review: Best tasting chicken in the world!
review_preview: If like myself you’re from the UK, it would be hard not to compare the chicken to Nando’s- I can confidently say, it is by far the best chicken I have ever had. We were very fortunate to of been sat down pretty soon after...
review_full: If like myself you’re from the UK, it would be hard not to compare the chicken to Nando’s- I can confidently say, it is by far the best chicken I have ever had.  We were very fortunate to of been sat down pretty soon after having arrived, as the only negative of this place is the total capacity for diners is very low. We saw quite a lot of people in the time we were there either wait out the front, or go elsewhere. Therefore, I’d highly recommend trying to visit at off peak hours, especially if you’re just visiting Madrid and don’t mind having lunch/ dinner at a less common time. The service was great, the atmosphere great, the food was phenomenal, and the price was extremely reasonable. If I ever return to Madrid I will be 100% revisiting this restaurant!

title_review: A good place for meat. Not more
review_preview: I'll start with the service. GREAT !!!  Very friendly and efficient.But... Ranked as #42 out of over 10,000 places in Madrid?  This shows the flaws of crowd based ranking system. Any system...Don't get me wrong, the meat was really good, but there are...
review_full: I'll start with the service. GREAT !!! Very friendly and efficient. But... Ranked as #42 out of over 10,000 places in Madrid? This shows the flaws of crowd based ranking system. Any system... Don't get me wrong, the meat was really good, but there are many steakhouses in Madrid that are better. If you seek fast, great plus service and good value for money, Mu is a great place. But it is too close to be considered as a fast food place... So if you are looking for a steakhouse for romantic/business/festive occasion, Mu! will not deliver that experience.

title_review: Visit to MU! El Placer de la Carne
review_preview: Me and my girlfriend went here to grab some food after noon soon after the place opened. The place became quickly crowded (i guess because of great food and service). We ordered cheese for starters and steaks for the main course. It was one of...
review_full: Me and my girlfriend went here to grab some food after noon soon after the place opened. The place became quickly crowded (i guess because of great food and service). We ordered cheese for starters and steaks for the main course. It was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. People serving in the restaurant had an amazing touch for serving customers. They were very friendly, always available and professional yet still relaxed. Very warm atmosphere. The starter was excellent and steaks were awesome, fries cooked to excellency. Wine was good and it was offered plenty. We went here again on our vacation and the waiter remembered what we like to drink without even telling. Our bill was around 56 euros and contained starters, main dishes, couple of cervezas and plenty of wine (the waiter was very eager to pour more wine into our glasses). Very strong recommendation from us.

review_preview: Having read the Tripadvisor reviews this restaurant had a lot to live up to. It did not disappoint. We were the first clients to arrive but from the start the atmosphere and surroundings were perfect. We liked the fact that the staff were friendly but...

We had the four course tasting menu with wine pairing. A fabulous choice.  Our favourite dishes were truffle mushroom with mash and confit egg, Wagyu beef and citron creme brûlée. Enjoyed the brief tour of the kitchen too.  We will be back.  Good luck in getting awarded your Michelin Star.

title_review: One of the best meals of my life.
review_preview: WOW what can I say. We visited this extraordinary restaurant this weekend for our wedding anniversary. From the minute we walked in, I knew this place was special. Everything about it was relaxed, comfortable, luxurious. The staff went out of their way to make the...
review_full: WOW what can I say. We visited this extraordinary restaurant this weekend for our wedding anniversary. From the minute we walked in, I knew this place was special. Everything about it was relaxed, comfortable, luxurious. The staff went out of their way to make the experience the very best. The decor is modern and minimalist which works well with the overall ambience. We had the 4 'steps' course menu which also came with 3 extra mini courses - vegetable appetizer, rhubarb sorbet and 3 yummy petit fours. The little table for your handbag is a nice touch. After our meal we were invited downtairs to meet Begona and her incredible team. The kitchens are spotless and seamlessly run - I can see why they would want to show it off. Begona took time out to have a chat with us and ask for our feedback which is always lovely to see someone who cares so deeply about their guests' experience. Thank you for making this weekend truly special. Here's to next time.

title_review: Excellent setting, but food not to our liking
review_preview: Excellent setting. Arrived with shopping and were shown our table. Staff good but waiting at table process needs perfecting.  You take drink order before food is served.  A lady brings your food and waits for someone to tell her who has served what. If you...
review_full: Excellent setting. Arrived with shopping and were shown our table. Staff good but waiting at table process needs perfecting. You take drink order before food is served. A lady brings your food and waits for someone to tell her who has served what. If you do not want one dish after the other suggest you tell when ordering.  Food looked a picture, but sauces were too reduced and salty for us or perhaps too much sauce. We did not like squid starter, nor prawn ‘stew’. Deer looked a picture but was cold in the middle and accompaniments too strong (salty/sweet) for me. Cod dish was tasty, but again very salty. Ideal for couples. Food went down a storm with other guests, just not us, hence gave it four stars. Daughter did not feel well so we left early and kind headwaiter offered a mint tea which was much appreciated. Wish I could have liked the place. We left before pudding so cannot comment.

review_preview: We ate here our last evening in Madrid. Situated on a quite side street in the upmarket shopping area of Salamanca the stylisheven minimalist decor matches the efficient and calm service. There was a choice between a prix fix four course menu with choices at...
review_full: We ate here our last evening in Madrid. Situated on a quite side street in the upmarket shopping area of Salamanca the stylisheven minimalist decor matches the efficient and calm service. There was a choice between a prix fix four course menu with choices at each stage and a six course menu surprise. We chose the four course and were delighted with each.. They were all beautifully presented and cooked. There was a slight difficulty with the "aged beef" dish which was rather too tough but this was exchanged very quickly and without fuss. We ate at 8pm and diners were still arriving as we left at 10pm. We were given a tour of the kitchen downstairs which was very impressive and we were surprised and pleased to find that one of the cooks was a young man from Bristol who had been there 3 months.  Wine by the glass was excellent and very reasonably priced

review_full: Etimo is a beautiful restaurant. You forget the hustle and bustle of the city the minute you step inside. It's like being at a spa. Our hotel made the lunch reservation for us, and we were greeted with smiles. My allergy was catered for and my amuse bouche was amazing. The menu was a little bit confusing, and what we ordered didn't always end up being what we thought. However, we were lucky as what I ordered was what my husband wanted and what he ordered I wanted! Everything was beautifully plated and everything tasted very well. My creme brulee was the highlight of the entire meal - don't skip dessert!  At the end of the meal we were offered a tour of the kitchen, which we thought was a nice touch.  It was a bit expensive, but we happily paid it due to the high quality of the food, the attentive staff and the tranquility of the experience in itself.

title_review: WOW!! Fine dining at its best!
review_preview: This is a GEM not to be missed.! On Ayala between Lagasca and Velasquez this relatively new restaurant, offers two great menus. We had the one with three selections for 55 euros . It was delicious! The ambience is elegant, sober. The food, where to...
review_full: This is a GEM not to be missed.! On Ayala between Lagasca and Velasquez this relatively new restaurant, offers two great menus. We had the one with three selections for 55 euros . It was delicious! The ambience is elegant, sober. The food, where to begin? A shiitake broth, rich yet delicate. Perfect. The asparagus and the artichokes beautifully presented, again delicious. So was the rest of the meal, the beef, the steak tartare .As desert we had the cheese plate and a chocolate napoleon. The wine list very good. We selected a gewürztraminer from Catalonia, a very pleasant surprise. Mark ups are fair. The Chef, Ms Begona Fraire, trained at the Cordon Bleu in Paris, a very pleasant and charismatic young lady, came to the table to inquire about the food and offer descriptions of the different dishes. A quite memorable experience. Reservations needed.

We went with the Chef’s Tasting and enjoyed one of the first pairings from their new sommelier. Every course was presented professionally, the flavors of each dish getting incrementally stronger. We were lucky enough to meet the Chef personally at the end of the evening. If you’re looking for a fine dining experience at a very reasonable price, this is the restaurant for your next visit to Madrid.

We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Tikka Masala with Naan bread and spiced rice to be shared. It was the best Indian dinner in my life: perfectly balanced in tastes and rich in quantity. We congratulated the chef on his Chicken Tikka Masala.  At the end of the dinner the waiter offered us a mix of wonderful spices to taste.  Very honest prices (50€ in two people and we can’t finish the Naan!). I would firmly recommend this Indian restaurant if you want a bite of real Indian food in Madrid.

title_review: Very good Indian restaurant in central Madrid
review_preview: According to Tripadvisor there are 10,600 restaurants in Madrid and Curry y Canela is currently listed as number 7.We went for dinner having reserved a table.  The décor is attractive.I have to say the waiter (maybe the owner?) was excellent, friendly, interested and...
review_full: According to Tripadvisor there are 10,600 restaurants in Madrid and Curry y Canela is currently listed as number 7. We went for dinner having reserved a table. The décor is attractive. I have to say the waiter (maybe the owner?) was excellent, friendly, interested and attentive. The complimentary pappadoms (with pickle tray) were crisp and fresh.  For main course, one chose chicken vindaloo 12.95€ and the other chose lamb rogan josh 13.95€ with white rice 4.95€ and a side dish of mixed tarka dahl (lentils) 9.95€ to share. Being British and therefore very accustomed to the spiciness of Indian food, we had ordered the vindaloo as this is normally very spicy and asked for the tarka dahl to be spicy, but for our tastes the food wasn’t particularly spicy. Yet I note that some Spanish reviewers (probably less accustomed to Indian food) found their dishes too spicy! A difficult situation for the restaurant owner, in meeting the client´s varied expectations, but all of the food was of very good quality and well presented. We recommend clients to discuss their preferred degree of spiciness with the waiter when ordering. One had mango ice cream 5.95€ as dessert which was delicious. Food was very good, service was excellent. We wish the restaurant owner and staff the best of success.

title_review: Lovely setting serving non-traditional Spanish cuisine

review_full: The address is an upper class neighbourhood in Barrio Salamanca Madrid in a lovely restored old mansion. The seating is very comfortable with tables set quite far apart. My partner had a very well prepared halibut but my beef was undercooked and indigestible. All in all it is a very innovative and refined menu prepared with market fresh ingredients. We would not hesitate to return.

title_review: Excellent Pizza and Pasta in Madrid . . .
review_preview: We´ve tried many restaurants in Madrid and this will be our new "go to" place for pizza and pasta.  It is a fairly new restaurant and opened only this past summer.  It is located on Fuencarral (steps from the Tribunal Metro stop) which is a...
review_full: We´ve tried many restaurants in Madrid and this will be our new "go to" place for pizza and pasta. It is a fairly new restaurant and opened only this past summer. It is located on Fuencarral (steps from the Tribunal Metro stop) which is a great pedestrian street area in downtown Madrid. If you´re interested in shopping and watching people, this is a good place to be, so finding this restaurant was a great surprise. There were four of us and we tried pizza (Margarita with Pepperoni and Del Monte), pasta (Tagliatelle de Bolognese) and a Gogonzola salad. With drinks the total came to about 50 Euros. Pretty nice considering the location and quality of the food. Flavor was great. Service was friendly and efficient and our food came surprisingly fast. You can actually watch them make the pizzas and cook them in three large ovens. Bathrooms are spacious and clean and they have paper towels to dry your hands. I´ve rated this Excellent not because you should expect a 5 star dining experience. I´ve rated it Excellent because the food, service, location and price was Excellent. We have already scheduled to go back next week. I expect we will visit often. Enjoy!!

title_review: It’s a MUST for foodies! Amazing!
review_preview: Our experience was amazing from the time we stepped foot inside the restaurant to the three hours later when we reluctantly left.  We opted for the full tasting menu, and because we were lucky enough to hit the season of mushrooms, we were delighted to...
review_full: Our experience was amazing from the time we stepped foot inside the restaurant to the three hours later when we reluctantly left. We opted for the full tasting menu, and because we were lucky enough to hit the season of mushrooms, we were delighted to have a number of plates with different mushrooms present full of flavour and mystery! The dining room was gorgeous and cozy. The staff were attentive, friendly, accommodating and made us feel like we were family. They taught us about the food being presented, right down to how to go about eating it so we didn’t look like rookies! we asked our server to pair our meals with wine for each course, which is highly recommended to get the most of your experience and learn about the different flavours that accompany a proper meal and wine pairing! Every course was surprising and delightful! At the end of our stay we were welcomed into the kitchen to take a little tour and met the pastry chef. We felt extremely honoured and it was a perfect and special ending to the best dining experience we’ve ever had. We’ve eaten Michelin star restaurants in the past, and although we wonder why this extremely talented chef and her team hasn’t been acknowledged with a star themselves, we’ve tasted their dishes and can confidently say the stars don’t make the restaurant when it comes to Etimo. Try it, you’ll fall in love and never want the experience to end!

review_preview: The Chef's Table was such a SPECIAL experience. As we were escorted through Etimo's beautiful dining room, we momentarily doubted our decision to eat dinner in the basement kitchen. But boy were we wrong. Etimo's food is outstanding...regardless of where you eat it. But I'm...
review_full: The Chef's Table was such a SPECIAL experience. As we were escorted through Etimo's beautiful dining room, we momentarily doubted our decision to eat dinner in the basement kitchen. But boy were we wrong. Etimo's food is outstanding...regardless of where you eat it. But I'm sure it tasted even better because we were surrounded by the friendly graciousness of Begona herself, as well as her very capable staff led by David, and the wonderful chefs who calmly make the magic happen. Begona, who is delightful and HARD working, was more than happy to show us all around the kitchen and share stories with us about the food and her family. We happened to meet the truffle guy who was delivering his seasonal bounty and proudly showed it off to us. We enjoyed seeing the chefs prep out their ingredients and review their notes. It was such an extraordinary opportunity to enjoy world class food in an intimate and unusual setting. As I sit back home in the states, it is the first experience that comes to mind when I think of our recent trip. If you are able to reserve the Chef's Table; DO IT.

review_preview: When planning our trip to Madrid, Etimo seemed like the ideal candidate for a splurge dinner, and it was. Reviews led us astray a bit in that the restaurant is NOT as vegetarian-friendly as some reviews made it out to be—they can work with you,...
review_full: When planning our trip to Madrid, Etimo seemed like the ideal candidate for a splurge dinner, and it was. Reviews led us astray a bit in that the restaurant is NOT as vegetarian-friendly as some reviews made it out to be—they can work with you, but it's a fixed menu, so often their vegetarian solution is just to eliminate the protein from the dish, which doesn't always leave you with a very filling meal. Luckily, my boyfriend was able to work around this and we had a delicious meal, opting for the 4-course tasting. Every single dish was delicious—the citrus creme brulee was a standout, as was the pre-first course shiitake broth. Excellent service and quality all around, and absolutely worth the money.

title_review: A Wonderful Experience that will Not be Forgotten for a Long Time!
review_preview: When our taxi driver dropped us outside Etimo's discreet facade - we were unprepared for the experience that awaited us. We were drawn into a warm and friendly ambience, where the tasting menu was explained to us. We chose the five-course tasting menu. To describe...
review_full: When our taxi driver dropped us outside Etimo's discreet facade - we were unprepared for the experience that awaited us. We were drawn into a warm and friendly ambience, where the tasting menu was explained to us. We chose the five-course tasting menu. To describe every dish in detail would take too many words, but the flavours and textures of each perfectly balanced dish prepared one for the arrival of the next. As each dish arrived, so did a detailed explanation from the perfectly English speaking waiting staff. My wife and I were lucky enough to meet Begoña in her kitchen, where we chatted about food and the excellent meal both of us had experienced. The kitchen was busy and at the height of service was calm and immaculate - almost military. My wife and I eat out a lot particularly in London and other European destinations, but Etimo has climbed to the top of our gastronomic experiences, including a few Michelin starred restaurants. I also had to confess to Begoña that there were a couple of dishes that I'm going to try hard to re-create in my own kitchen. I could say, a must to visit if we're in Madrid again, but I really think Etimo is worth hopping on a plane for, just for the experience.

review_preview: With a group of friends I have just had the pleasure of trying three of the top restaurants in Madrid in the same week – Cebo, Etimo and Montes des Galicia.They are all excellent. You should have a very good meal and an enjoyable...
review_full: With a group of friends I have just had the pleasure of trying three of the top restaurants in Madrid in the same week – Cebo, Etimo and Montes des Galicia. They are all excellent. You should have a very good meal and an enjoyable evening in each of them. We did.  The menu and quality of food and presentation at Etimo was outstanding. It was imaginative, delicate, mouth watering and thoroughly enjoyable. It must be the best in Madrid. The table service was a bit hesitant (reflecting the fact that the restaurant has only been open 5 months) but the Chef and Maitre ensured this did not affect overall service. The menu at Montes was a brilliant mixture of new and familiar. It included a fois gras starter, a favourite of mine, and the sirloin steak melted in the mouth. The service was excellent. Wine flowed like water. The whole evening was a delightful entertainment. Cebu was by far the best for classical service and for elegance but I found the set menu rather too experimental for my taste and some of the flavours extreme. In my personal opinion, last week Etimo was first for food, closely followed by Montes. Cebo was first for classical service. And Montes was first for all-round fun and engagement.

review_preview: We were delighted and amazed at the innovative creations of Begoña Fraire, her respect for the ingredients, her pairing of flavors and textures to tantalize our taste buds. The atmosphere is serene, beautiful, elegant but never pretentious; the staff is knowledgeable, they show good command...
review_full: We were delighted and amazed at the innovative creations of Begoña Fraire, her respect for the ingredients, her pairing of flavors and textures to tantalize our taste buds. The atmosphere is serene, beautiful, elegant but never pretentious; the staff is knowledgeable, they show good command of English and explained the different dishes of the tasting menu so well. Also, they made a wonderful selection of the wine as per our description of what we like. The whole evening was amazing and inspiring. We especially loved the setas in the first course, the vieiras and salmonete second, and the bonito, the chipirones and the vaca vieja third courses. The desserts offered another impressive creativity, especially the queso de cabra and the creme brûlée of citrus. The cheese board was outstandingly paired, the sweet wine balancing the assertive flavors. Meeting and chatting with Begonia gave us the opportunity to discuss food, compliment her and her team for a truly outstanding dining experience. My husband, our son and myself will remember this evening for a long time!

The kitchen was big and spacious and clean a good working environment.  The food have a good fusion taste... Every dishes have authentic taste, the best creme brulee I ever have tasted. The macaroons is a lot better then the famous Laduree in Paris and similar the the macaroons of Luxemburgerli of Switzerland that is to die for. Crunchy outside and chewy inside.  We would definitely.come,back and recommend this place.

We tried the Felini Bocadillo (€8.50) that was good. The Iberian ham was nice. Sandwich was supposed to be served with arugula but came with a different salad green instead. We also tried the Choripan (€5.50), sausage was ok, not very spicy but tasted fine with mustard provided on the table. Both sandwiches came with fries that were ok as well.  Overall, nothing exciting nor wrong with our late night sandwiches at Mu! El Placer De La Carne. This is an affordable and potentially convenient place for those staying or spending time around Plaza del Carmen to Calle Grand Via.

Tucked away in a small passageway in a busy area of the Centro of Madrid. We were greeted at the door by the owner and one of the team...we found that this has only opened 3 months ago and only received rave reviews - we now know why!  The design is contemporary - unfinished plaster walls with a super modern touches and well lit. Seats around 28 only so very cosy and intimate, nice little touches like scatter cushions on the banquettes, unique crockery really enhanced the presentation of the food ....service was amazing, staff speak great English and made every effort to accommodate our requirements. Small, curated menu of around 5/6 Appetizers, Starters and Mains with a handful of desserts....everything we selected was delicious....high quality ingredients, beautifully presented. Try the sea bass carpaccio, Steak Tartar with Quals Eggs and the Pork - so tasty! Wine list is small but affordably priced. We selected 4-5 dishes and enjoyed a couple of beers and a glass of wine for under Euro55 - great value for this quality....it will top the chart in Madrid restaurants at some point so dont miss out before it gets too popular! We booked at 8.45 and it was quiet when we arrived, by 9.30 it was packed! Enjoy!

The attention to detail was amazing and the flvours of each dish carefully thought out to enable an exquisite dinning experience. For the main tapas dishes were share the croquettes, with an additional twist from the usual by the inclusion of a bechamal sauce, a catfish dish in the style of a ceviche accompanied with artichoke and a wasabi pea puree and finally the argentinian steak which was cooked to perfection. Finally we shared a desert of pineapple with a lime marscapone cream. From start to finish everything was excellent, ther service was impecable. A thoroughly enjoyable night and one that I plan to repeat the next time I visit Madrid. An absolutely must.

review_preview: We had our favorite meal during a week in Spain at Toga. This small restaurant is a gem. We knew we wanted to eat in the Calle de la Cava Baja area. Once we got there we searched on Trip Advisor and identified Toga as...
review_full: We had our favorite meal during a week in Spain at Toga. This small restaurant is a gem. We knew we wanted to eat in the Calle de la Cava Baja area. Once we got there we searched on Trip Advisor and identified Toga as our destination. We arrived around 9:00pm and the restaurant was almost empty. As it turns out we were lucky to get a table because by 9:40 it was full.  We really enjoyed everything about our experience here. The atmosphere was cute and friendly. Our server was terrific. His English was certainly better than our Spanish and he was very friendly. He helped us make selections from the menu and sequenced them to highlight our experience. All of the food we ordered was fantastic. Tasteful, fresh and authentic.  Most of the other tables seemed to be filled with locals. Togo felt like an authentic Spanish restaurant. There is nothing touristy about it at all. If you are visiting Madrid, you should do yourself a favor and eat at Toga.

The food is mostly Peruvian (ceviche...) & Argentinian and it is AMAZING. The menu is pretty small which, in my opinion, shows that the ingredients are fresh. We've been there 3 times and we tried different dishes every time and they were all delicious. The staff is very passionate and proud of their restaurant. They are very nice and dedicated people who take time to talk to you and answer any questions even when the place is full (and still manage to serve the food quite quickly).  We went back and we will go back again. Great staff, great food, great vibe !

title_review: Combining top class food with care, creativity and texture
review_preview: I know Begoña Fraire from “68”, the previous restaurant she led that became my center of “food pleasure moments” either for business or with friends. I was able to visit her again at “Étimo”, her new restaurant in the center of Madrid. It represents the...
review_full: I know Begoña Fraire from “68”, the previous restaurant she led that became my center of “food pleasure moments” either for business or with friends. I was able to visit her again at “Étimo”, her new restaurant in the center of Madrid. It represents the evolution of her style, care for the environment and atmosphere and food experience. It was her first opening day, with over half of the team new. But I was able to experience the same lovely food touch, but at the next level.  At Etimo you will be able to sense and eat lovely sophisticated food at a very reasonable price. For me the highest is always how she brings to life top quality food that she carefully selects with new textures and tastes. A pleasure to the eyes as well, it’s looks as delicious as in your mouth. The desserts are a must have as well so create that space when enjoying the food.  She makes a delicious daily bread, something that I consider a must for a restaurant if that quality.  I would clearly recommend any dish from the menu. Or just check with her and her team what are they specially proud that day. In my first visit, I selected the “Salteado de Setas de Temporada, Mató Casero y Pesto de Salvia”, followed by the “Bonito, Risotto Escabechado y Albahaca” (her preferred version, which is the spicy one) and to end, the fabulous “Manzana, Arroz con Leche y Maíz”.  Go and enjoy! With our couple, group of friends or business meal.

The menu & wine list isn't extensive but all of the dishes were very good. We had 2 starters; the beef strips & tomato, anchovies & avocado- both were excellent. For mains the pork was extremely tender & cooked to perfection; so too was the pasta my wife ordered. We shared the pineapple dessert which was excellent. Overall we couldn't fault our meal here. The food, atmosphere & attention from the staff was just right. If you visit here you won't be disappointed.

title_review: The very best restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: I was attending a medical conference and tried out four of the top twelve trip advisor restaurants. Toga was my number 1 by far. I had butterfish crevice (really nice south american fish that I've never had before), argentinian steak accompanied by chimichurri followed by...
review_full: I was attending a medical conference and tried out four of the top twelve trip advisor restaurants. Toga was my number 1 by far. I had butterfish crevice (really nice south american fish that I've never had before), argentinian steak accompanied by chimichurri followed by pineapple with lime mascarpone (the very lightest and fresh summer dessert).  The atmosphere was friendly and cosy - perfect!! Need to book as it is a small place. What's added bonus is that the price is very reasonable. Not surprised that it has moved up to number 1 position in trip advisor. Will return when I'm back in Madrid.

Did alot of research before travelling, and based on reviews and their innovative cuisine it seemed as an obvious choice. It did not disappoint.  We had the four course menu, and for 60€ it was of great value. All courses were prepared to perfection. The service of waiters was friendly but a bit more uneven. We requested wine pairing to go with our selected dishes, but we had to request new wines ourselves, and since they already had brougth the food it took too long getting the wine in time to enjoy with the food. However all in all a good food experience.  A very nice end to the evening was the invitation to visit the kitchen by chef Begoña Fraire.

title_review: 5 star lunch at an all world value rate
review_preview: This place is tiny and you might walk right past it as it's on a small alley but not far from plaza mayor. We got the goat cheese and veal pinxtos and both were among the best we've had in Spain, surpassed only by the...
review_full: This place is tiny and you might walk right past it as it's on a small alley but not far from plaza mayor. We got the goat cheese and veal pinxtos and both were among the best we've had in Spain, surpassed only by the Foie at Bar Sport in San Sebastian. We also got the kimchi noodles with raw tuna which was exceptional and the steak tartare which was just as good with amazing unique flavor profiles and balance on both. We sampled all the red wines which were delicious and a steal at under 3 euros a glass. The chocolate dolce de leche desert wad the only dish that didn't blow us away but was still very good. The whole meal was under 50 euros and I would have been thrilled if it wad twice that much.

And the pineapple with mascarpone, the latter just AMAZING!

In general, the food was creative and good. the desserts were not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Also, we ordered a bottle of rose champagne to drink with the entire meal. The bottle was placed in an ice bucket across the room. As the dining room filled up with diners, it took longer and longer to refile our champagne glasses. The ice bucket should be moved closer to the tables, so diners can refill their own glasses when necessary. The high point of the experience was being invited to see the kitchen and speak to the owner after we had finished dinner.

review_preview: It isn't often that I give a place five stars.  This review is based on my own experience; my partner wasn't so impressed.  This was because he is vegetarian and I do eat fish, so I had much more choice and was completely satisfied, whereas...
review_full: It isn't often that I give a place five stars. This review is based on my own experience; my partner wasn't so impressed. This was because he is vegetarian and I do eat fish, so I had much more choice and was completely satisfied, whereas he left feeling a bit hungry. The service was great - especially from the waiter who was as passionate about wine as I am! We had a conversation about the wonderful Amphora Roja which I chose, and which I would thoroughly recommend. Each of the five courses was like a work of art; although they were beautiful to look at, I do not mean that. I mean each was a masterpiece of flavour and texture. There were unexpected combinations, but they all worked beautifully. The cod was unlike anything I have ever had - utterly 'melt in the mouth'. I felt curious about the avocado chocolate dessert, which sounded strange but was richly delicious. My favourite dish of the evening was the bisque which was perfect. The chef herself was amazing to talk to also - what a lovely evening we had! I look forward to visiting again when we are next in Madrid.

It was the little attention to detail that was missing - Not explaining why we had to wait until 9.30pm when we arrived at 9pm for our dinner - Not assisting us with our wine glasses when moving to our table - Not serving bread to start - some staff didn't explain the dishes when it's served - the swinging door to the a rewarding shouldn't have been placed near the entrance when it can easily swing out and hit a customer What is commendable: - some staff did explain the history and inspiration of the chef, as well as the ingredients of the dishes - a personalized kitchen visit for every customer (I asked and she does it for every client). Clearly passionate about what she does

What a magnificent experience for us and our taste buds! Every course was sensational. The explosions of flavors and tastes was incredible, and the presentation of the food exquisite. Every dish was explained in detail and the service was impeccable. What a pleasure it was to see all the chefs at work. The calmness of the kitchen was remarkable. Begoña made us feel very welcome in her kitchen. She is clearly very passionate about what she does and her attention to detail is commendable. This was a very special and unique experience. Definitely one of the best gastronomic experiences I’ve ever had. Wishing continued success to Begoña and her team.

I can’t describe enough how good and tasty the food was. We had the butterfish cheviche, pear and gorgonzola on bread, ribeye steak, tuna with noodles and tenderloin Urugyan style served on bread. Everything was so excellent and we were so happy with the service. One of our best meals ever.  Thank you so much Toga for the warm welcome and great food. We will come back.

review_preview: We hadn’t booked, but they squeezed the two of us in just prior to another reservation and I am so glad they did! The butterfish ceviche is genuinely the most delicious thing I’ve ever tasted. The tuna noodles were also wonderful- the tuna tasted fresh...
review_full: We hadn’t booked, but they squeezed the two of us in just prior to another reservation and I am so glad they did!  The butterfish ceviche is genuinely the most delicious thing I’ve ever tasted. The tuna noodles were also wonderful- the tuna tasted fresh from the sea, and everything else we had, (the steak and the tomato pintxos) was also lovely. The waiters and staff were friendly and helpful and one even (nicely) told me off for my over generous use of the steak sauce, which indicated to us that they really care about the dining experience. We finished with a pineapple dessert to share, which we didn’t really have room for, but was suggested by the waiter, so we couldn’t say no. It was unsurprisingly wonderful.  Thoroughly recommend that you visit here if you come to Madrid.

review_preview: I took my son here to celebrate a graduation.  The decor is elegant and the tables nicely spread apart.  The service was excellent but the real star is the food.  If one is looking for standard Spanish food, this is not the place.  The ingredients...
review_full: I took my son here to celebrate a graduation. The decor is elegant and the tables nicely spread apart. The service was excellent but the real star is the food. If one is looking for standard Spanish food, this is not the place. The ingredients were seasonal with interesting combinations, and less typical wines available by the glass. I appreciated the opportunity after our meal to stop downstairs to see the kitchen and meet the chef/owner. It is always more memorable when one can put a face with the experience. I would go back if I return to Madrid.

review_preview: We were recently in Madrid for a weekend, and it was very busy and beautiful weather.  We had lots of tapas but decided to stop for an early dinner at Oven - its a quaint little restaurant and it was quite busy.  The staff were...
review_full: We were recently in Madrid for a weekend, and it was very busy and beautiful weather. We had lots of tapas but decided to stop for an early dinner at Oven - its a quaint little restaurant and it was quite busy. The staff were very accommodating, and welcoming, and found us a table by the actual ovens. Menu was varied and we ordered some Pizza. The Pizzas must rate among the best I have ever had! The food order came trough quickly - quicker than we had "planned" for, so be prepared (they were not hurrying us, just very efficient). Costs were what you would expect, not expensive, but not cheap as its in the middle of Madrid. We enjoyed the food, had a few drinks, and overall a great experience - we will definitely come back next time we are in Madrid!

title_review: Great food, a wonderful chef and a beautiful place.
review_preview: For our trip, we were looking for an upscale, modern European dining experience that also can do a vegetarian option. After some research, we booked a table at Restaurante Étimo.When entering the restaurant, it somehow felt like walking into a newly opened New York...
review_full: For our trip, we were looking for an upscale, modern European dining experience that also can do a vegetarian option. After some research, we booked a table at Restaurante Étimo. When entering the restaurant, it somehow felt like walking into a newly opened New York restaurant - in a good way (and not as dense). The interior is kept relatively plain, with a painted brick wall, linen on the table and some colored glassware. We started with a nice aperitivo - a 2011 Cava. As I already indicated in the reservation that I'm vegetarian, the waiter explained which menu items could be prepared in a vegetarian way. We went for the five courses, with a vegetarian option for me (at first, the waiter suggested that I would only take four courses as a fifth one might be difficult - but apparently the chef then told him she could also modify another dish into a vegetarian option). Also, we got a very nice Thousand Milk's 2011, a white assemblage from Rioja - suggested by their sommelier on the wine list.  The menu is composed as two starters, then a fish and afterwards a meat dish (or one of the two in case you go for four courses), sorbet to clean the pallet and finally a dessert. When served, all dishes got explained by the waiter - and all of them were delicious, full of flavor, well-seasoned and beautifully plated. After the meal, the waiter told us that Begoña worried whether the vegetarian version didn't disappoint - I reassured him that she doesn't have to.  The overall meal with all courses, aperitivo and wine came down to 241 EUR, which is not cheap - but an absolutely fair price for good produce and excellent work. When paying, Begoña dropped by, asked how it was and offered to show us the kitchen. We gladly took the offer. We had an inspiring discussion about her background, food and on whether she wants a star in the Guide. Talking to her was as much a highlight of the evening as the great food. We will definitely come again when we are in town next.

title_review: A true pleasure from start to finish
review_preview: We were fortunate enough to dine at Etimo during our last evening in Madrid. It is definitely one of my top 5 restaurant experiences and is comparable with 1-star Michelin dining. We had the pleasure of having Raul as our waiter for the majority of...
review_full: We were fortunate enough to dine at Etimo during our last evening in Madrid. It is definitely one of my top 5 restaurant experiences and is comparable with 1-star Michelin dining.  We had the pleasure of having Raul as our waiter for the majority of the evening and went with the 4 course menu. Apart from a single steak tartar, which was a tiny bit over seasoned, everything was great from the get go. The squid ink salmorejo and the passion fruit crème brûlée were showstoppers! After the dining we had a guided tour of the kitchen and were told about their sustainable philosophy, as they try to exclusively use free-range and organic products as well as maximise in house production (baking own bread and handmade chocolate etc). It was impressive and unique to hear about the mentality of the head chef see things from "backstage".  An amazing experience and whenever we come back to Madrid, we are definitely visiting again.

review_preview: Booked this restaurant well in advance for my wife's Birthday during a four day visit to Madrid and could not have chosen better. On arrival the entrance is fairly modest but the dining room is comfy and although contemporary has a real elegance and charm....
review_full: Booked this restaurant well in advance for my wife's Birthday during a four day visit to Madrid and could not have chosen better. On arrival the entrance is fairly modest but the dining room is comfy and although contemporary has a real elegance and charm. The staff were delightful and had real passion and knowledge of the food being served. They were friendly and attentive, taking great pride in describing each course. There was a four or five course option that had balance regardless of your choice. We went for the five course option and I'm delighted we did as each course seemed to link seamlessly. Delicious appetizers, bread, pre-desert palate cleanser and petit fours added to the experience. Every course, from the octopus, crayfish, black cod, beef and extraordinary creme brulee was a beautiful blend of taste and texture and showcased the skill of this very talented chef. Even the wine, recommended by staff was a joy (and remarkably inexpensive!).  After our meal we were invited to meet the chef and see the kitchen - having done this exchange of pleasantries a few times I wasn't too bothered but even this turned into a lovely experience. The chef; Begona Fraire came across to chat and was an absolute delight. She has a passion and understanding of food that shone through and was so interested in what my wife and I had to say about our own foodie experiences. We left feeling very privileged to have experienced this wonderful restaurant and will make every effort to revisit when we are next in the beautiful City of Madrid.

title_review: Came back to Madrid specifically for this restaurant, but not a third time
review_preview: We loved the food and the environment the first time we visited, really good Argentinean meat and good service. We loved it so much we decided to come back for a city break in Madrid to specifically eat at a couple of restaurants we wanted...
review_full: We loved the food and the environment the first time we visited, really good Argentinean meat and good service. We loved it so much we decided to come back for a city break in Madrid to specifically eat at a couple of restaurants we wanted to return to. Including this one. As much as the meat was as good as expected, our experience was less so this time. We went on a Saturday evening, so presumably more people, we tried to book a table but they don't do reservations so had to wait outside 15 minutes. As fluent our Spanish was, the waiter insisted on speaking english and felt more of some generic know nothing tourists, asking if we knew what chimichuri was. When we ordered our food and asked for red wine, they did not disclose what wine it was nor was given the choice. They made a mistake with my partner's order so ended up with something different than what she ordered. I recommend for the food, but the dining experience can be hit or miss.

The waiters/wairtresses are running around (clearly not enough of them) working hard so you spend the whole evening trying to catch their eye to request something. This is tedious and not good customer service. My sons main course carbonara was cold (and it takes a lot for him to complain, he hates to make a fuss) they clearly whacked it in the microwave, slammed it back down in front of him and couldn’t have cared less whether it was ok or not. Shame, nice place but I also got the impression that the staff found tourists a bore. Wouldn’t go back.

review_preview: I'll cut to the chase, this place was a disaster. My wife and I have been incredibly fortunate in our lives to eat at several Michelin star winning or deserving eateries. This is so far from that it's not even a conversation. I have no...
review_full: I'll cut to the chase, this place was a disaster. My wife and I have been incredibly fortunate in our lives to eat at several Michelin star winning or deserving eateries. This is so far from that it's not even a conversation. I have no idea how and why anyone gives this restaurant high marks.  The service at Etimo is a joke. We were given menus but no wine menus. We then ordered and got a starter and waited at least 3-4 minutes before someone scampered over and explained what was in front of us and what the progression of this starter was. Simple things that any fine dining experience knows to do. The other problem is the waiters don't communicate so you have 2-3 different people asking if you know what you're eating. But never once does anyone ask if its any good, which is smart because, besides the starters, the answer would have been no.  My wife and I both at the last minute decided to go with the 4-courses instead of five because we had some trepidation on the menu after the lack of knowledge by the servers. I am so glad we did. Just to give some highlights the tuna was the fishiest tuna I've ever had. The beef which was cooked rare instead of medium rare was a cheap top sirloin and rather lousy, and the palette cleanser made me want to vomit. By the time the meal ended my wife and I were laughing at just how utterly bad the entire experience was, and then they swiped my credit card for almost $200 and it became less funny. Look I think the decor and the ambiance could be a real winner. But the menu is odd, the items which we had at least 50% of the menu were all bad, and the service was atrocious for this price for a meal. There are so many amazing places to eat in Madrid, do not make the same mistake we did and eat here.

title_review: Best food I've tasted in Madrid!
review_preview: This is a must try place if you visit Madrid. Its Spanish food with an Asian spin on it.  The food is absolutely fantastic here and the staff were extremely professional and helpful too. I had read many reviews on TripAdvisor already so decided to...
review_full: This is a must try place if you visit Madrid. Its Spanish food with an Asian spin on it. The food is absolutely fantastic here and the staff were extremely professional and helpful too. I had read many reviews on TripAdvisor already so decided to go on the many recommendations and order the ceviche for starters and tuna noodle dish also. Its definitely something I wouldn't want to order by hearing the name but it was absolutely amazing. My favourite was the tuna noodle dish. We then ordered pork and veg which was also delicious and two Australian couples that sat beside us highly recommended the cheese dish which we then ordered to share also. All food was top notch and such amazing value for money. I would not hesitate in recommending this place....its actually a must try!!! Fantastic service, value for money and most importantly fantastic food. Thank you for the experience.

title_review: The tuna noodle bowl special is fantastic
review_preview: We ate here on our last night in Madrid. They have a tuna noodle dish, not the one on the menu, it was the special. I believe they usually have it. The waiter said it was a must have. I highly recommend to try this...
review_full: We ate here on our last night in Madrid. They have a tuna noodle dish, not the one on the menu, it was the special. I believe they usually have it. The waiter said it was a must have. I highly recommend to try this dish. It is amazing, one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life. My girlfriend agreed and she doesn’t even like seafood. The other dishes were good as well. One of them was the portabella carpaccio, the dish is a cold dish. I liked it but my girlfriend expected it to be a warm dish so she didn’t like it as much. Anyway, get the Tuna special and you will be extremely pleased with it. Sad I may never get a chance to eat it again, so good. Also great service as well. I would recommend a reservation.

review_preview: We were looking on Trip Advisor for a nearby venue for a quick evening meal, of something other than jamon, while in Madrid the other day.TOGA was well reviewed, and when contacted by phone could seat us on the day.After following Mr Google’s...
review_full: We were looking on Trip Advisor for a nearby venue for a quick evening meal, of something other than jamon, while in Madrid the other day. TOGA was well reviewed, and when contacted by phone could seat us on the day. After following Mr Google’s directions we were wondering about where we were being lead! We found, on the way back to our hotel after our lovely evening, that Google maps doesn’t necessarily avoid boring industrial streets! Back to TOGA - a delightfully modern feel to the cozy restaurant - we were greeted by friendly staff who knew their menu well, and were proud of the food they prepared. Sarah and I shared a ceviche starter, and I took the waiter’s recommendation of a special noodle dish flavoured with kim-chee - innovative and very tasty. The couple sitting at the table next to us, a father and daughter from Ireland, were helpful, in that they had been to TOGA the previous night as well, and we took note of their recommendations. For a non-traditional meal near central Madrid, you won’t go wrong with TOGA.
