review_full: We have had some good meals during our time in Spain, and quite a few bad meals. This meal was amazing. Two and a half hours of amazing food and wine. The service was perfect. Despite a packed house the staff took the time to chat with us and discuss the food and Spain in general. We ended up eating several pinchos and 5 entrees. But with the entrees at 8 euro, mains at 12 euro and the wine at 3 euro a glass, it was great value. We wish we had come here every night in Madrid. A lot of the reviews here on trip advisor in Spain have to be taken with a pinch of salt, but if you come to Madrid you have to come here at least once. Book ahead though.

He explained the menu to us and, as noted in many posts, the 10,5 euro deal is good. However, we chose to select things a la carte.  We started with the spicy sausage and the empanada which we enjoyed. We followed up the appetizers with the angus sirloin, ribs, fries and a salad. All were of good quality and cooked well. The red wine and draft beer were very good! The service was excellent and the price was very reasonable! We highly recommend this restaurant.

review_preview: Just an outstanding experience while visiting Madrid. is located conveniently. It's about halfway between either the Tirso de Molina and La Latina Metro stop. Surprisingly, not many reviews on yelp but well worth your time. it was our favorite restaurant during a 3+ week trip...
review_full: Just an outstanding experience while visiting Madrid. is located conveniently. It's about halfway between either the Tirso de Molina and La Latina Metro stop. Surprisingly, not many reviews on yelp but well worth your time. it was our favorite restaurant during a 3+ week trip to Spain. We enjoyed it so much that we came to nights in a row ( as they are closed on Mondays). While you do not absolutely need a reservation if you show up at 8 o'clock in the evening, they are popular enough that they will only give you a one hour seating time. This is enough to have a pleasant meal but if you really want to enjoy yourself make a reservation ahead of time. What makes this place so good? Of course, the food is outstanding. The pork dish melts in your mouth and on the second night I decided to get the tuna sashimi with kimchi mayonnaise special which seems to be on the menu fairly regularly.the explosion of flavor when I took my first bite was incredible. The first night I had cerviche which was fine though I think there are better choices.  The thing that makes this a complete experiences that the staff is wonderful. They're hard-working, happy, helpful, and smile at you. This total ambience that they are both serving good food and also enjoy having you there is something that very few restaurants offer. at the end of our second meal, our favorite server even brought us each an aperitif to show complete our meal in typical Spanish fashion. Can't say enough about this place. We spent €40 the first night for two of us and 60 the second for meal that I would clearly be willing to spend $150-200 for the US.

review_preview: We were staying near the Palacio Real and, on the strength of other reviews, ventured to the Lavapies neighborhood for what turned out to be a fantastic meal at Toga -- by far our best meal in Madrid, and very likely the best during our...
review_full: We were staying near the Palacio Real and, on the strength of other reviews, ventured to the Lavapies neighborhood for what turned out to be a fantastic meal at Toga -- by far our best meal in Madrid, and very likely the best during our three-week stay in Spain (which included a Michelin one-star restaurant on the Costa Blanca). The restaurant is indeed small, tucked away on a quiet side street a few blocks from the Plaza Mayor, and it's essential to make a reservation -- we saw several parties turned away (though the restaurant was accommodating in encouraging a group to return at 11 for a late dinner). We were especially glad to find that Toga was open on Sunday evening, as many other Madrid restaurants are closed at that time. The staff were very warm, friendly, and helpful in recommending wines to pair with our food. The sun-dried tomato/avocado/anchovy pintxo, the butterfish ceviche, and the croquettes were all excellent -- and the kitchen kindly prepared a tasty simple pasta for our son. The chocolate and dulche de leche alfajor was a perfect conclusion to the meal, served with a Spanish digestif and delicious cortado. The service was attentive, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming -- a modern take on traditional Spanish food, drawing a youthful, non-touristy crowd. Toga was the perfect conclusion to our stay in Madrid, and I only wish we hadn't found it on our last night -- we would definitely have returned to try many other dishes. Absolutely worth a visit!

review_preview: My friend and I had just come back from a 10 day trip to the mountains of western Spain. Our diet had been limited to eating only basic vegetarian food and we were excited about testing the culinary reputation of one of the worlds great...
review_full: My friend and I had just come back from a 10 day trip to the mountains of western Spain. Our diet had been limited to eating only basic vegetarian food and we were excited about testing the culinary reputation of one of the worlds great food cities. We trawled trip advisor and Toga was near and highly rated. The decor was lo-fi and quietly underplayed the magic ahead. Our plan was to focus on dipping into the tastes of the ocean via the recommends from the warm and smiling team running the show. And what a show. The kimchi flavoured tuna noodles were a highlight, battling with the generous butterfish cerviche for top ranking. The seafood squid risotto took bronze with a magnificent performance on the tastebuds. Our encore was a ridiculously chocolatey-chocolate triumph lightly crunchy on the outside that overwhelmed the sensations when you went in deep - absolutely stunning. The whole lot came to less than 50 euros which could be considered a gift. Our mountains retreat had been a wonderful experience but Toga was kind enough to remind us that the civilisation can offer it’s own spectacular delights. Muchos Gracias.

review_preview: We were so glad we had lunch at Toga when visiting Madrid. Everything in the menu sounded good and we couldn’t decide, so we got recommendations from the waiter and shared all our dishes. We started with a ceviche of butterfish which was amazing. The...
review_full: We were so glad we had lunch at Toga when visiting Madrid. Everything in the menu sounded good and we couldn’t decide, so we got recommendations from the waiter and shared all our dishes. We started with a ceviche of butterfish which was amazing. The creaminess of the avocado and the zing of the red onion worked well.  Next up we tried wok fried noodles with raw tuna. This too was fresh, tasty, and the flavours of the fish certainly came out. We followed this with a fillet of Iberian pork with grilled vegetable which was lovely. We couldn’t leave without trying a dessert and so we went for pancakes with dulce de leche and banana which was amazing - very sweet, but so good! The staff were friendly and helpful and gave fantastic recommendations on the food and wine. At less than €60 with coffee and 2 glasses of wine each, this was fantastic value for the quality and creativity of the food. I wish I could go back!

review_full: I was very excited as I was booking a table for me and my friend, mostly because of the female chef and the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Apparently, the restaurant did not get the message about an allergy that I have to a certain vegetable. It was shocking how little flexibility the chef has and how much adaptation she lacks. I was able to find most dishes that did not have the particular ingredient. However, when it came to the mushroom dish, I was served plain mushrooms!!! I mean really how difficult is it to throw some seasoning, any sauce on top to just give the mushrooms some flavor? The rest of the food was very good though with an excellent presentation. The female staff who attended to us initially was not the most welcoming. We ordered a wine bottle recommended by the sommelier only to be told bit later that they no longer have it.  Overall, this experience was disappointing especially where I was there to celebrate a special occasion. I would not come back to this restaurant or recommend it to friends or family. Too bad as I am a big fan of female chefs in general.

review_preview: We visited on Fri 2nd August for a birthday meal for myself and a pal.  The restaurant is lovely inside. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming.We chose the 4 course taster menu with the wine option whereby there was wine served to compliment...
review_full: We visited on Fri 2nd August for a birthday meal for myself and a pal. The restaurant is lovely inside.  The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. We chose the 4 course taster menu with the wine option whereby there was wine served to compliment each dish. Everything we ate tasted delicious and the attention to detail on the presentation of the food was just amazing. We were.given a lot of detail about everything on our plates and I just couldn't believe how tasty everything was. We thought the 70 euro price was very reasonable for the delicious food and the experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the wine served with each dish and loved hearing the background story for each of the wines we tried. However, we all felt like we were overcharged for the wine. They gave us very small amounts each time to go with each course and weren't really offering to top our glasses up much either.  It was a fantastic dining experience and I would definitely recommend Etimo.

TarTar was delicious as was the tuna and everything else.  We ordered everything at once, armature move, you should order one or two small plates then when you finish order the next and so on. I knew the staff was great when we were ordering and he said that is probably enough for two you can always order more after. Many places will just encourage you to order more to pad the bill, not here.  Cool clean decor, fun music, not a tourist trap, will return. Consider contacting them for a reservation.

review_preview: What can I say other than when in Spain, you eat the best food ever! But being a little tired of regular tapas and beer, we decided search the Trip advisor site to find that hidden gem. Toga being classed a 14 out of 11,000+...
review_full: What can I say other than when in Spain, you eat the best food ever! But being a little tired of regular tapas and beer, we decided search the Trip advisor site to find that hidden gem. Toga being classed a 14 out of 11,000+ restaurants in Madrid we thought, we have to eat here! Are we ever glad we did. This little but quaint place is remarquable. Right off the bat, we were greeted with a smile, which sadly is not always the case being tourist and all. The waiters spoke perfect English. They tended to our every need and more. The four of us were completely impressed with the quality of food served to us. We all had different entrees and meals in order to do some tasting. EVERYTHING was outstanding. The ambiance was also very trendy with lounge music and modern feel. I totally recommend this place and would go back again if weren't leaving for home in the morning.

review_preview: There are so many cafes, bars and restaurants in Madrid to choose from so rather than taking a complete gamble on where to eat on our last night I consulted Trip Advisor and selected Toga based on the reviews.It does say on Trip Advisor...
review_full: There are so many cafes, bars and restaurants in Madrid to choose from so rather than taking a complete gamble on where to eat on our last night I consulted Trip Advisor and selected Toga based on the reviews. It does say on Trip Advisor that the restaurant is open from 1:00pm-1:00am however when we arrived there at 8:00pm it was just opening. We were able to reserve a table for 8.30pm although they had to turn away a large group who were queued behind us as they were pretty much fully booked. The restaurant itself is clean and modern with only around 30 covers at max capacity, the toilets are also modern and very clean. The menu is small, consisting of 4 pinchos, mains and desserts and 10 entrees. We opted for a couple of pinchos each and a main of the Argentinian rib eye followed by a dessert each. We also had one bottle of wine and our bill came to just over €80 which we were really surprised by as the standard of the food being served was fantastic. The waiting staff are all very polite and sociable and know each dish on the menu inside out and were happy to give recommendations or advise on combinations. We got talking to the couple on the table next to us and instead of opting for a main they ordered three different entrees to share, which were all brought out to them separately, were of a good portion size for sharing and the presentation of each dish was perfect. All in all an unassuming little place, not on a main street so Google maps was required, a nice intimate restaurant but really busy all the same with fantastic food and service and high standards of cleanliness.

review_preview: We found Toga on Trip Advisor.  We were happy to see that the restaurant was only 2 blocks away from where we are staying and decided to give it a try while in Madrid. The experience was wonderful.  The owners greeted us (They speak English!)...
review_full: We found Toga on Trip Advisor. We were happy to see that the restaurant was only 2 blocks away from where we are staying and decided to give it a try while in Madrid.  The experience was wonderful. The owners greeted us (They speak English!) and explained the menu very descriptively. They were also able to give us recommendations from their menu which is not always easy to obtain in Madrid. We ordered their pasta special with raw tuna, the scallop with buckwheat pearls and beets, the butterfish, and the Argentinian steak. The dishes were amazing. The pasta was made with rice noodles. We can only describe it as a super ramped up Pad Thai. The creamy sauce was flavored with cilantro and lime. We were advised to mix the tuna into the mixture, and the pasta became pure heaven! The scallop dish was so aesthetically pleasing, it looked like a plate from a Michelin star restaurant and tasted just as wonderful. The Butter Fish, which was raw, was also amazing. It was flavored with some citrus and also an acid finish, almost like a Japanese Ponzu sauce.  The dessert was worth saving room for as well. I would full-heartedly recommend Toga. The owners are from Argentina and they are the warmest hosts you can wish for.

title_review: Cozy neighborhood spot with terrific food
review_preview: Toga was suggested to us by our hotel concierge and we were thrilled with our experience. Toga is a small, neighborhood spot with concrete walls & modern decor, a small counter which serves as the bar for the waiters and seating for about 30 guests....
review_full: Toga was suggested to us by our hotel concierge and we were thrilled with our experience. Toga is a small, neighborhood spot with concrete walls & modern decor, a small counter which serves as the bar for the waiters and seating for about 30 guests. As this is such a small restaurant, you are noticed when you walk in and as you sit at your table, so you are very well taken care of by the waitstaff from beginning to end of your delicious meal. We listened to our waiter's suggestions and began with a tapas dish of grilled bread with goat cheese and poppy seeds-very tasty. This was followed by a thai noodle dish topped with sushi style tuna. We were a little surprised by Toga offering a thai dish, but it was so terrific that we ordered another portion! We also ordered the squid ink risotto with parmesan cheese, a good dish but a bit soupy and rich. The house wine was great and incredibly reasonable. This was a very good, well priced, well served meal.

I’d highly recommend this restaurant, they were open to our bad Spanish and our server spoke great English too! Five stars!
